channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: The metric geometry of paper surfaces under geometric constraints
item.description: arXiv:2602.10826v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We investigate the quasisymmetric uniformization of a special class of metric surfaces known as paper surfaces, constructed as quotients of planar multipolygons via segment pairings, including infinite Type W identifications. These spaces, which arise naturally in dynamical settings, exhibit conic singularities and complex geometric structure. Our goal is to prove that a broad class of such surfaces satisfies Ahlfors 2-regularity and linear local contractibility, which together ensure the existence of a quasisymmetric parametrization onto the standard 2-sphere.
item.dc:creator: Luciana Menezes Vasconcelos

item.title: Simple connectedness of the Ran space
item.description: arXiv:2602.09815v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: The space of all finite non-empty subsets of a topological space $X$, also known as the Ran space of $X$, is weakly contractible for $X$ path connected. We consider subspaces $\mathrm{Ran}_{\leqslant n}(X)$ of the Ran space given by all subsets of $X$ of size at most $n$, and present results on their first homotopy groups. In particular, we show that the induced map $\pi_1(\mathrm{Ran}_{\leqslant n}(X)) \to \pi_1(\mathrm{Ran}_{\leqslant n+2}(X))$ is trivial for all positive integers $n$, and even more, show that $\pi_1(\mathrm{Ran}_{\leqslant n}(X)) = 0$ for all $n\geqslant 4$, by explicitly drawing the path homotopies that contract any loop to a point.
item.dc:creator: J\=anis Lazovskis
